globalEvents.name: Open Crate 1
globalEvents.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

globalEvents.name: Mission Briefing
globalEvents.eventText:
Even though you know your plan is solid — all you need to do is hold the line long enough for everyone to be safe inside the bunker — it's still is a terrifying sight to see the Imperial force making its way down the mountain toward you.

You see the vicious Sorin in the back, flanked by an artillery tank and troopers, commanding his legion on toward destruction.

{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.

eventActions.theText: {-} When a healthy Rebel figure is adjacent to the checkpoint that is the target of an attack, that Rebel figure becomes the target of the attack.

enemyGroupData.customText:
{-} When a healthy Rebel figure is adjacent to the checkpoint that is the target of an attack, that Rebel figure becomes the target of the attack.
{-} When BOMBARD is not the bonus effect, this figure gains "BOMBARD: This figure's attacks do not require line of sight or Accuracy." When BOMBARD is the bonus effect, this figure gains 1 {g}.
{-} DEFENSIBLE: Recover 3 {H}.
{Q}{A} Attack the closest checkpoint. Then, attack a different checkpoint.
{Q} Attack the closest checkpoint.
{A} If this figure has suffered {H}, it recovers 3 {H}.
{A} If this figure has suffered {H}, it recovers 3 {H}.

eventActions.theText: You take a final glance at your various checkpoints, hoping they will hold long enough to keep reinforcements at bay.

entityProperties.name: Checkpoint Red
entityProperties.theText:
The defense checkpoint is still holding, keeping the Imperial forces at bay.

{-} An Imperial figure can attack a defense checkpoint (Health: 10, Defense: 1 {G}).
{-} When an attack targeting a defense checkpoint is declared, apply +2 {G} to its defense results if it is adjacent to 1 or more healthy Rebel figures.

eventActions.theText:
{-} Rebel mission tokens represent defense checkpoints. An Imperial figure can attack a defense checkpoint (Health: 10, Defense: 1 {G}).
{-} When a defense checkpoint is destroyed, flip the token to the Imperial side. Imperial mission tokens are active deployment points.
A hastily erected siege wall is protecting Haven while Benex evacuates his people.

entityProperties.name: Siege Wall 1
entityProperties.theText:
The siege wall is protecting Haven while the residents flee to the bunker - for now.

{-} The neutral mission tokens represent a siege wall. An Imperial figure can attack the siege wall (Health: 20, Defense: 1 {G}). Apply +1 {G} to the siege wall’s defense results for each defense checkpoint on the map.
{-} When an attack targeting a defense checkpoint or the siege wall is declared, apply +2 {G} to its defense results if it is adjacent to 1 or more healthy Rebel figures.
{-} Rebel figures do not block line of sight to the siege wall.

entityProperties.name: Siege Wall 2
entityProperties.theText:
The siege wall is protecting Haven while the residents flee to the bunker - for now.

{-} When an attack targeting a defense checkpoint or the siege wall is declared, apply +2 {G} to its defense results if it is adjacent to 1 or more healthy Rebel figures.
{-} Rebel figures do not block line of sight to the siege wall.

eventActions.theText:
{-} The neutral mission tokens represent a siege wall. An Imperial figure can attack the siege wall (Health: 20, Defense: 1 {G}). Apply +1 {G} to the siege wall’s defense results for each defense checkpoint on the map.
{-} When an attack targeting a defense checkpoint or the siege wall is declared, apply +2 {G} to its defense results if it is adjacent to 1 or more healthy Rebel figures.
{-} Rebel figures do not block line of sight to the siege wall.

You turn towards the Imperial forces again and secure your positions.

{-} The Rebels win at the end of Round 7.
{-} The Rebels lose when the siege wall is destroyed.
Defend the checkpoints and the siege wall.

{-} Rebel mission tokens represent defense checkpoints. An Imperial figure can attack a defense checkpoint (Health: 10, Defense: 1 {G}).
{-} When a defense checkpoint is destroyed, flip the token to the Imperial side. Imperial mission tokens are active deployment points.
{-} The neutral mission tokens represent a siege wall. An Imperial figure can attack the siege wall (Health: 20, Defense: 1 {G}). Apply +1 {G} to the siege wall’s defense results for each defense checkpoint on the map.
{-} When an attack targeting a defense checkpoint or the siege wall is declared, apply +2 {G} to its defense results if it is adjacent to 1 or more healthy Rebel figures.
{-} Rebel figures do not block line of sight to the siege wall.
{-} The Rebels win at the end of Round 7.
{-} The Rebels lose when the siege wall is destroyed.

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels win
globalEvents.eventText:
You hear a blaring mechanical horn sound behind you. This is the signal; the evacuation is complete! You immediately retreat, leaving the Imperial forces behind, incapable of reaching their targets.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} Each hero receives 2 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.
{-} If <color="red">General Sorin</color> was defeated before the end of Round 3, heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

eventActions.theText:
In the fallout of the battle you search desperately for Benex, but he is nowhere to be found. His home is strangely undamaged by the siege. Looking for answers, you find a dataslate with a single chilling message: “I had no choice. I'm so sorry.” The dataslate contains Alliance security codes, Imperial communication channels, records of Alliance secret projects, and records of communication with Sorin himself. But most frighteningly of all, you see access codes to, and the location of, the nearest major Rebel outpost. You rush to your ship; you are the last hope that base has.

{-} Place Story Mission card “Our Last Hope” into play.

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels lose
globalEvents.eventText:
There is nothing more you can do; the defense checkpoints and siege wall are overrun, and the Imperials are coming. You run to the bunker and tell them to seal the door. They plead with you that there are more coming, but you know you have to save as many lives as you can. You override the controls and seal the bunker, hoping that some of those who didn’t make it can find refuge elsewhere.

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.
{-} If <color="red">General Sorin</color> was defeated before the end of Round 3, heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

eventActions.theText:
In the fallout of the battle you search desperately for Benex, but he is nowhere to be found. His home is strangely undamaged by the siege. Looking for answers, you find a dataslate with a single chilling message: “I had no choice. I'm so sorry.” The dataslate contains Alliance security codes, Imperial communication channels, records of Alliance secret projects, and records of communication with Sorin himself. But most frighteningly of all, you see access codes to, and the location of, the nearest major Rebel outpost. You rush to your ship; you are the last hope that base has.

{-} Place Story Mission card “Our Last Hope” into play.

globalEvents.name: The Power of the Empire
globalEvents.eventText: You still hold your ground against the Imperial assault when a terryfing combat walker comes stomping down the mountain pass.

globalEvents.name: Combat Surge 1
globalEvents.eventText:
Combat medics and technicians spread out, reinvigorating the Imperial forces.

{-} The Imperial figure with the highest figure cost that has suffered the most {H} recovers 6 {H}.

globalEvents.name: Combat Surge 2
globalEvents.eventText:
Whipped on by their commanders, the Imperial forces surge forward.

{-} The two Imperial figures with the highest figure cost that are not <color="red">Focused</color> become <color="red">Focused</color>.

globalEvents.name: Combat Surge 3
globalEvents.eventText: You see landing shuttles flying overhead. More troops will join the fight soon.

globalEvents.name: Checkpoint Destroyed Red
globalEvents.eventText: Under the relentless Imperial onslaught, one of the defense checkpoints is finally overrun.

entityProperties.name: Checkpoint Red
entityProperties.theText:
The defense checkpoint is still holding, keeping the Imperial forces at bay.

{-} An Imperial figure can attack a defense checkpoint (Health: 10, Defense: 1 {G}).
{-} When an attack targeting a defense checkpoint is declared, apply +2 {G} to its defense results if it is adjacent to 1 or more healthy Rebel figures.

entityProperties.name: Checkpoint Red Gone
entityProperties.theText: The defense checkpoint lies in rubbles an is being used as a temporary base by the Imperials.

globalEvents.name: First Wave
globalEvents.eventText: Shortly after your defense checkpoint is obliterated, further waves of Imperials pour in to augment the already terrifying forces.

globalEvents.name: Second Wave
globalEvents.eventText: The Imperials seem endless. You wonder how you can possibly hold out for much longer. You hope that Benex is close to moving everyone.

globalEvents.name: Third Wave
globalEvents.eventText: As more Imperial reinforcements arrive, you try to contact Benex for an update on the evacuation efforts, but you hear nothing back. Trying to push the worst possibilities out of your mind, you steel yourself to keep fighting, giving the civilians and refugees as much time as you can.
